A cross-sectional, anonymous survey assessed patient use of, interest in, and communication preferences concerning CAM. The 150 respondents primarily self-identified as Hispanic (74%), were born outside the United States (55%), were medically insured (56%), and had a high school education or less (55%). Of these respondents, 63% used at least 1 type of CAM; the most commonly used were: vitamins/supplements (15%) and chiropractic (11%).
